articles.content: On this crisp October morning, it feels like half of the internet is dealing with a hangover. A severe Amazon Web Services outage took out many, many websites, apps, games and other services that rely on Amazon‚Äôs cloud division to stay up and running. According to the AWS service health page , Amazon was looking into "increased error rates and latencies for multiple AWS services" in the US-EAST-1 region (i.e. data centers in Northern Virginia) as of 3:11AM ET on Monday. articles.content: There's yet another streaming bundle in town, and it will be ideal for fans of Ted Lasso and The Office . Apple and NBC have teamed up to provide both of their streaming services together in a bundle starting at $15 per month. The new Apple TV + Peacock bundle is officially available now for $15 monthly for the ad-supported tier. This is a mighty fine deal, given that Apple TV recently changed both its name and price . The platform costs $13 per month now on its own. Peacock starts at $11 per mo
articles.author: Lawrence Bonk

Meanwhile, an estimated 295 million people experienced acute levels of hunger across 53 countries that same year. Globa
articles.content: In a world where approximately 8.2 percent of the global population‚Äîaround 673 million people ‚Äîfaced hunger in 2024, the paradox of food shortages alongside massive waste is stark. Meanwhile, an estimated 295 million people experienced acute levels of hunger across 53 countries that same year. Globally, about one-third of all food produced is lost or wasted annually, amounting to roughly 1.3 billion tons . This waste not only exacerbates environmental issues but also represents a missed opportun
articles.author: Martin Danilanez

articles.content: Introduction How many times a week do you type ‚Äú What is my IP ‚Äù into Google? articles.content: Ford‚Äôs Mustang Mach-E is having a relatively good year, outpacing its gas brethren in sales for the month of August. The expiration of the $7,500 federal EV tax credit doesn‚Äôt mean much to the Mach-E, which is made in Mexico and therefore ineligible for the credit. But with clouds looming on the horizon, Ford wants to keep the momentum going by releasing a new special edition version that harkens back to the pony car‚Äôs bygone days. articles.content: Today‚Äôs Decoder episode is a special one: I‚Äôm talking to Zocdoc CEO Oliver Kharraz, and we chatted live onstage at the TechFutures conference here in New York City. Johnston is the founder and sole employee of The Midas Project: a nonprofit that monitors the practices of "leading AI companies to ensure tr
articles.content: On August 19th at 7:07PM, Tyler Johnston received a message from his roommate. A man, the text said, was knocking on their door with legal documents to serve. Johnston is the founder and sole employee of The Midas Project: a nonprofit that monitors the practices of "leading AI companies to ensure transparency, privacy, and ethical standards are maintained." The Midas Project is behind The OpenAI Files , a 50-page report about OpenAI's evolution from under-the-radar nonprofit to moneymaking house

articles.content: Monarch Money is one of our favorite budgeting apps and, fittingly enough, there's a way for newcomers to save money on a subscription right now. articles.content: Science Corporation‚Äîa competitor to Neuralink founded by the former president of Elon Musk’s brain-interface venture‚Äîhas leapfrogged its rival after acquiring a vision implant that’s in advanced testing, for a fire-sale price. The implant produces a form of ‚Äúartificial vision‚Äù that lets some patients read text and do crosswords, according to a report published in The New England Journal of Medicine today . The implant is a microelectronic chip placed under the retina. Using signals f
articles.author: Antonio Regalado

articles.title: AI could predict who will have a heart attack
articles.description: For all the modern marvels of cardiology, we struggle to predict who will have a heart attack. Many people never get screened at all. Now, startups like Bunkerhill Health, Nanox.AI, and HeartLung Technologies are applying AI algorithms to screen millions of CT scans for early signs of heart disease.
articles.content: For all the modern marvels of cardiology, we struggle to predict who will have a heart attack. Many people never get screened at all. Now, startups like Bunkerhill Health , Nanox.AI , and HeartLung Technologies are applying AI algorithms to screen millions of CT scans for early signs of heart disease. This technology could be a breakthrough for public health, applying an old tool to uncover patients whose high risk for a heart attack is hiding in plain sight. But it remains unproven at scale whi
articles.author: Vishal Khetpal

articles.title: Should an AI copy of you help decide if you live or die?
articles.description: Doctors share top concerns of AI surrogates aiding life-or-death decisions.
articles.content: For more than a decade, researchers have wondered whether artificial intelligence could help predict what incapacitated patients might want when doctors must make life-or-death decisions on their behalf. It remains one of the most high-stakes questions in health care AI today. But as AI improves, some experts increasingly see it as inevitable that digital ‚Äúclones‚Äù of patients could one day aid family members, doctors, and ethics boards in making end-of-life decisions that are aligned with a pati
articles.author: Ashley Belanger
